evidence: These links are short videos that explain some of the key concepts we discussed in more detail.

Spin echo is one of the most fundamental sequences in MRI, so watching those demonstrations will help reinforce how a ninety-degree pulse and a one-eighty-degree pulse work together to refocus the signal.
Gradient echo is a variation where gradients are used to generate echoes instead of a one-eighty-degree pulse.
As we discussed, slice selection is how we target a specific region of the body by combining a magnetic gradient with the RF pulse.

Spin echo is one of the most fundamental sequences in MRI, so watching those demonstrations will help reinforce how a ninety-degree pulse and a one-eighty-degree pulse work together to refocus the signal.
Gradient echo is a variation where gradients are used to generate echoes instead of a one-eighty-degree pulse.
As we discussed, slice selection is how we target a specific region of the body by combining a magnetic gradient with the RF pulse.
This slide is a list of extra resources for you to explore outside the lecture. These links are short videos that explain some of the key concepts we discussed in more detail.
